item.title: Project 1: AI Models for Legal Text Processing
item.description: Used state-of-the-art transformer models fine-tuned on legal text data and focused on key tasks such as text classification, text generation, and text summarization using BERT, GPT-2, and PEGASUS. Designed streamlit app where user can upload legal documents and summarize text. Fine-tuned PEGASUS model on indian legal documents for text summarization task. Published the model on Hugging Face. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Project 2: Used Car Price Prediction
item.description: Designed a Streamlit app to predict the price of used cars based on inputs provided by users like manufacturer name, engine type, and production year. Employed AWS services like AWS Sagemaker for training XGBoost regression model and AWS EC2 instance for streamlit app. Obtained R2 score of 90% for the XGBoost regression model. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Project 3: Analyzing Crime Statistics across US
item.description: Developed 2 Tableau dashboards to highlight the severity of crime and mortality trends in the US that provided an opportunity to inform evidence-based policymaking. Designed stacked bar charts showing victims affected under different age groups. The dataset was collected by the Federal Bureau of Investigation’s Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) Program through the National Incident-Based Reporting System (NIBRS).

item.title: Project 4: Automatic Ship Classification from Satellite Images
item.description: Classified optical aerial images of ships to monitor unlawful activities in international waters. Captured images in visible spectrum by employing transfer learning models on multi-class imbalanced dataset. Achieved 77.5% F1 score using VGG16 pre-trained model. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Project 5: Forest cover prediction

item.title: Project 6: Bank churn prediction
item.description: Performed statistical tests to figure out important attributes affecting customer churn Applied SMOTE technique to handle imbalanced data and implemented logistic regression model Achieving an AUCscore of 74.1%. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: Project 7: Heart Disease Prediction
item.description: Improved AUC score to 72% from 54% after balancing data using SMOTE and furnished insights on factors affecting heart disease Performed EDA, correlation matrix, VIF values and implemented logistic regression. Link to GitHub repository

item.title: About
item.description: As a Technical Support Assistant - II at The George Washington University (GWU), I provide technical assistance and troubleshooting to students, faculty, and staff using various software and hardware systems. I also collaborate with the IT team to implement and maintain IT policies and procedures, and to improve the quality and efficiency of the technical support services. I am currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Science at GWU, where I am learning how to apply advanced analytical and computational techniques to solve real-world problems.
